page.title: 12INTERVIEW cont:
page.content: husband on the farm because I don't know anything about farming as I was brought up in a town and also because I have no time. I never feel isolated up here as I have my car, but before I could drive I did feel isolated. The disadvantages about living up here is that if I run out of anything I have to go to Caistor because they are the nearest shops. I often have visitors but never unexpected visitors. They always ring me before they come. In winter if it snows hard the roads can get blocked but since the airport has been extended the main road is not blocked for long. I buy as much as town people but in the summer I grow as much as possible and what is not eaten is frozen. I cook a main meal at dinner because I know my husband will be home because at tea he is late because of either
